benchmark_details.name: NCSE v2.0 (Nineteenth-Century Serials Edition Version 2.0)
benchmark_details.overview: The NCSE v2.0 dataset features improved article identification, high-quality OCR, and text classified into four types and seventeen topics, created from a collection of 19th-century English newspapers and periodicals using an image-to-text model.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a new, cleaned, classified, and searchable dataset of 19th-century newspapers for the benefit of historians and social scientists.

data.source: A collection of 84,000 pages of 19th-century English newspapers and periodicals.
data.annotation: Manual annotation using bounding box techniques and classification algorithms.

methodology.calculation: Character Error Rate (CER) is calculated as the sum of character substitutions, deletions, and insertions divided by the total number of characters.
methodology.interpretation: A lower CER indicates better OCR accuracy. An F1 Score measures the balance between precision and recall in classification tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Pixtral achieved a median CER of 0.01, outperforming all other OCR methods.
methodology.validation: Evaluation was performed on the NCSE test set and BLN600 for quality assurance.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY).
